isis.stitle: FRONT DRIVE AXLE WHEEL ENDS: FABCO SDA-12 - REASSEMBLY - SPINDLE YOKE TO SUSPENSION YOKE

step1.para: With the spindle yoke upright, position the outer drive yoke horizontally. If the spindle yoke assembly includes the brakes and wheel hub, it should be attached to and supported by a suitable jack or hoist. Position the lower kingpin ball (well lubricated) under lower kingpin ball socket in the suspension yoke ( Figure 23). The spindle yoke assembly must be tilted outward at the top slightly to allow the ball stud to enter its socket.
Raise the spindle yoke assembly until the ball stud enters the socket. Align the upper kingpin mounting holes with the corresponding holes in the spindle yoke.

Install only three bolts ( Figure 22). The lower rear bolt is the steering stop bolt. Washers under the fourth bolt's head will limit the maximum turn angle on the steerable drive end. The bolts should pass through the camber adjusting shim or shims ( Figure 22). The same number of washers and the same shims should be reused in a reassembly of parts that have previously been together. Also refer to STEERING STOP ADJUSTMENT, and CAMBER ADJUSTMENT. Tighten locknuts to 175 ft-lbs. (235 N·m).
